Question:
Simplify the following expression
$\dfrac{7}{9} \times \dfrac{1}{5} - \dfrac{4}{6} \div \dfrac{3}{2}$
Solution_text:
--------------------------------------SOLUTION-------------------------------------------
$\dfrac{7}{9} \times \dfrac{1}{5} - \dfrac{4}{6} \div \dfrac{3}{2}$
=$\dfrac{7}{9} \times \dfrac{1}{5} - \dfrac{4}{6} \times \dfrac{2}{3}$ ...(convert division to multiplication)
= $\dfrac{(7\times1)}{(9\times5)}-\dfrac{(4\times2)}{(6�3)}$
= $\dfrac{7}{45} - \dfrac{4}{9}$ ...(multiplication first)
= $\dfrac{(7\times9 - 4\times45)}{(45\times9)}$ ...(then, subtraction)
= $\dfrac{(63 - 180)}{(405)}$
= $\dfrac{-117}{405}$
=$\dfrac{-13}{45}$
Hence the correct answer is $\dfrac{-13}{45}$.

Question:
Simplify the following expression
$\dfrac{8}{3} - \dfrac{5}{8} \div \dfrac{9}{3} \times \dfrac{5}{6}$
Solution_text:
--------------------------------------SOLUTION-------------------------------------------
$\dfrac{8}{3} - \dfrac{5}{8} \div \dfrac{9}{3} \times \dfrac{5}{6}$
=$\dfrac{8}{3} - \dfrac{5}{8} \times \dfrac{3}{9} \times \dfrac{5}{6}$ ...(convert division to multiplication)
= $\dfrac{8}{3} - \dfrac{(5\times3)}{(8\times9)} \times \dfrac{5}{6}$
= $\dfrac{8}{3} - \dfrac{15}{72} \times \dfrac{5}{6}$
= $\dfrac{8}{3} - \dfrac{(5\times5)}{(24\times6)}$
= $\dfrac{8}{3} - \dfrac{25}{144}$ ...(multiplication first)
= $\dfrac{(8\times144 - 25\times3)}{(3\times144)}$ ...(then, subtraction)
= $\dfrac{(1152 - 75)}{432}$
= $\dfrac{1077}{432}$
=$\dfrac{359}{144}$
Hence the correct answer is $\dfrac{359}{144}$.

Question:
Simplify the following expression
$\dfrac{6}{5} - \dfrac{2}{5} \div \dfrac{7}{3} \times \dfrac{9}{2}$
Solution_text:
--------------------------------------SOLUTION-------------------------------------------
$\dfrac{6}{5} - \dfrac{2}{5} \div \dfrac{7}{3} \times \dfrac{9}{2}$
=$\dfrac{6}{5} - \dfrac{2}{5} \times \dfrac{3}{7} \times \dfrac{9}{2}$ ...(convert division to multiplication)
= $\dfrac{6}{5} - \dfrac{(2\times3)}{(5\times7)} \times \dfrac{9}{2}$
= $\dfrac{6}{5} - \dfrac{6}{35} \times \dfrac{9}{2}$
= $\dfrac{6}{5} - \dfrac{(6\times9)}{(35\times2)}$
= $\dfrac{6}{5} - \dfrac{27}{35}$ ...(multiplication first)
= $\dfrac{(6\times35 - 27\times5)}{(5\times35)}$ ...(then, subtraction)
= $\dfrac{(210 - 135)}{175}$
= $\dfrac{75}{175}$
=$\dfrac{3}{7}$
Hence the correct answer is $\dfrac{3}{7}$.

Question:
Simplify the following expression
$\dfrac{8}{4} + \dfrac{4}{2} \div \dfrac{3}{7} \div \dfrac{7}{1}$
Solution_text:
--------------------------------------SOLUTION-------------------------------------------
$\dfrac{8}{4} + \dfrac{4}{2} \div \dfrac{3}{7} \div \dfrac{7}{1}$
=$\dfrac{8}{4} + \dfrac{4}{2} \times \dfrac{7}{3} \times \dfrac{1}{7}$ ...(convert division to multiplication)
= $\dfrac{8}{4} + \dfrac{(4\times7)}{(2�3)} \times \dfrac{1}{7}$
= $\dfrac{8}{4} + \dfrac{28}{6} \times \dfrac{1}{7}$
= $\dfrac{8}{4} + \dfrac{(14\times1)}{(3\times7)}$
= $\dfrac{8}{4} + \dfrac{2}{3}$ ...(multiplication first)
= $\dfrac{(8\times3 + 2\times4)}{(4\times3)}$ ...(then, addition)
= $\dfrac{(24 + 8)}{12}$
= $\dfrac{32}{12}$
=$\dfrac{8}{3}$
Hence the correct answer is $\dfrac{8}{3}$.

Question:
Simplify the following expression
$\dfrac{9}{2} - \dfrac{5}{8} \times \dfrac{9}{4} \div \dfrac{1}{5}$
Solution_text:
--------------------------------------SOLUTION-------------------------------------------
$\dfrac{9}{2} - \dfrac{5}{8} \times \dfrac{9}{4} \div \dfrac{1}{5}$
=$\dfrac{9}{2} - \dfrac{5}{8} \times \dfrac{9}{4} \times \dfrac{5}{1}$ ...(convert division to multiplication)
= $\dfrac{9}{2} - \dfrac{5}{8} \times \dfrac{(9\times5)}{(4\times1)}$
= $\dfrac{9}{2} - \dfrac{5}{8} \times \dfrac{45}{4}$
= $\dfrac{9}{2} - \dfrac{(5\times45)}{(8\times4)}$
= $\dfrac{9}{2} - \dfrac{25}{16}$ ...(multiplication first)
= $\dfrac{(9\times16 - 25\times2)}{(2\times16)}$ ...(then, subtraction)
= $\dfrac{(144 - 50)}{32}$
= $\dfrac{94}{32}$
=$\dfrac{47}{16}$
Hence the correct answer is $\dfrac{47}{16}$.
